metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20445 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
HttpObjectDecoder.java in Netty before 4.1.44 allows a Content-Length header to be accompanied by a second Content-Length header, or by a Transfer-Encoding header. It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-3.9-java - 3.9.0.Final-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
netty-3.9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.9.0.Final-1ubuntu0.1').
